column4: I have an ATI radeon Xpress 1100, is anti-aliasing supported in ubuntu?
or anyway to enable it?
it is supported, probably already enabled... you can change to add subpixel rendering if you want it to be cooler still
I want it to make compiz look nicer and smoother
#ubuntu-effects, btw, use beryl or compiz fusion :)
thats what I'm using, fusion
and your fonts look funny?
they're fine to me
I just want the cube to be smoother
oh, well... that's not so much anti-aliasing
how so? then what is it that I should do
get an nvidia or intel ;)  or petition ati/amd to release better drivers... or help the avivo open source ati driver project
I'm on a laptop
I hate ATI
is there any setting manager for ATI cards
driconf is the only one i know of
I want it to look nicer... and I saw anti-aliasing makes it look amazing, so
you using fglrx and xgl to get compiz fusion?
thats what I'm on
xgl is just slow too... did you search the forums for antialiasing?
or #ubuntu-effects?
Its not that its slow, it runs fine. Its just that the lines don't look nice on the cube, as in you can see where the pixels are separating  (hard to explain)
Its just very very obviously aliased
yeah, sorry, got me... I bet it's and upstream compiz issue moreso than anything specific to you
